data.title: Linux Mint 1.11.1 - Extension library unreachable with http.proxy setting only in GUI.
data.body:
**Version info:**

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1  ( `code_1.11.1-1491486998_amd64.deb` )
- OS Version: Linux Mint - Ubuntu 14.04 - x86_64 

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Be on a machine that requires a proxy, we'll say `my-proxy.example.com:80`.
2. Set the following user settings
    * `"http.proxy": "http://my-proxy.example.com:80"`
3. Test that the proxy works with code by installing via the command line:  
    ``` 
    :~$ code --install-extension AdamCaviness.theme-monokai-dark-soda
    Found 'AdamCaviness.theme-monokai-dark-soda' in the marketplace.
    Installing...
    Extension 'AdamCaviness.theme-monokai-dark-soda' v0.0.5 was successfully installed!
    ```
4. Run code via `:~$ code --verbose`
5. Try to search or install extensions using the UI. For example, `ext install python`. 
6. Observe that no information is displayed with Visual Studio code, but on the CLI the following error is shown:

```
[32413:0407/120533:INFO:CONSOLE(28)] "An unknown error occurred. Please consult the log for more details.", source: file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js (28)
WARNING: Promise with no error callback:6
{ exception: 
   Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE
       at Error (native),
  error: null,
  promise: 
   { _creator: null,
     _nextState: null,
     _state: 
      { name: 'error',
        enter: [Function: enter],
        cancel: [Function: s],
        done: null,
        then: null,
        _completed: [Function: s],
        _error: [Function: s],
        _notify: [Function: m],
        _progress: [Function: s],
        _setCompleteValue: [Function: s],
        _setErrorValue: [Function: s] },
     _listeners: null,
     _value: 
      Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE
          at Error (native),
     _isException: true,
     _errorId: 6,
     done: [Function: done],
     then: [Function: then] },
  handler: undefined,
  id: 6,
  parent: undefined }
Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE
    at Error (native)
[uncaught exception in main]: Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE

Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE
    at Error (native)
Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE

Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE
    at Error (native)
    at Timeout._onTimeout (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:15297)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:232:11)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:202:5)
[32413:0407/120535:INFO:CONSOLE(29)] "net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE

Error: net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE

    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:232:11)

[32413:0407/120550:INFO:CONSOLE(20)] "ApplicationInsights:Sender", source: /usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/applicationinsights/Library/Logging.js (20)

data.title: Added missing commands to the Settings page
data.body:
**Before**:
In the Settings page (`Cmd + ,` on Mac), certain git commands were missing in the search and were also marked as not recognized when using them:
![screen shot 2017-04-07 at 2 18 47 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3534924/24813753/423ef5a6-1b9d-11e7-9aa9-d56ca3eb77ac.png)
![screen shot 2017-04-07 at 2 18 23 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3534924/24813754/424597bc-1b9d-11e7-9874-ab9dd5be362f.png)

**Now**:
The Settings page correctly returns the missing git commands and they are recognized by the editor:
![screen shot 2017-04-07 at 2 19 24 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3534924/24813777/5bff9fd6-1b9d-11e7-8d47-0d76206e0f57.png)
![screen shot 2017-04-07 at 2 19 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3534924/24813776/5bff7dda-1b9d-11e7-97c1-7a88e012881b.png)

data.title: Update bot for auto labeling issues, especially for extension development
data.body:
Problem: users and extension developers need a place for sharing and upvoting extension ideas, exchanging implementation ideas, and committing to working on them.

Right now GitHub and gitter are the most central locations for making extension suggestions, but issues need manually labeled by the team.

Suggestion:

Specify a convention for extension suggestions that can be autolabeled by a GitHub bot.

I.e "[extension][debugger] Debugger for prolog" would be autolabeled extension and debugger. This would help provide a bit more "organized" way of discussing extension development amongst the community.

This pattern could be extended to all [tags] in issue titles if desired. This would of course only work with community education and participation.

If there are other suggestions for this I would be happy to hear them :-)

data.title: Blank VSCode window on upgrade to 1.11.x
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.x
- OS Version: Fedora 25

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7602755/24812979/92912aae-1bcc-11e7-8b10-c3002cbf9fdf.png)

This is what I get upon launching VSCode from the graphical launcher after updating either to `1.11.0` or or `1.11.1`. I've tried renaming the extensions folder and the user config folder to prevent VSCode from loading them but that didn't seem to change anything.

Reverting back to `1.10.2` makes everything work fine again. Launching `code` / `/usr/share/code/bin/code` from the command line seems to work however. Only directly launching `/usr/share/code/code` doesn't work anymore.

Unfortunately I haven't been able to reproduce the problem when trying to install VSCode on a virtual machine, which makes me think the problem might be something I caused myself... but I can't seem to grasp what could do anything like this, since it only happened right after updating VSCode.

data.title: Unclear error message in chrome debug
data.body:
During the Angular test tour.

1) install Chrome debug extension
2) create chrome launch config
```json
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "chrome",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Chrome",
            "url": "http://localhost:3000",
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}"
        }
    ]
```
3) `npm start`
4) start chrome and open page on `http://localhost:3000`
5) launch the created launch config
-> timeout

When chrome is not running everything is fine.  There error message should be more clear that chrome is not running in debug mode when I launch it manually.

data.title: Feature request: Add context menu to branch name in lower left
data.body:
Version 1.11 changed the default action when you clicked on the branch name on the lower left from opening an input with `git checkout` already filled to an input for the git checkout command itself.  The previous pre-filled input was nice in that you could replace "checkout" with "branch" and create a new branch.

Instead of cluttering the new popup ui with a branch option you could add a context menu to the branch name in the lower left corner that would contain `branch` and optionally other common commands which you can access now in the ellipsis menu in the git pane (note: `branch` is not available right now in the git pane ellipsis menu).

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Upgrade to 1.11.1
2. Look at the Source Control tab. Previously this did not show git ignored files (eg. the node_modules folder). Now it does.

data.title: No Error Displayed when Trying to Attach to an Invalid Debug Port in the Debugger
data.body:
**Repo**

1. Install and start the angular quick start: https://github.com/angular/quickstart
2. Start server on port 3000
3. Create a `launch.json` that tries to attach to port 3000 :

    ```
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "name": "Attach to Port",
            "address": "localhost",
            "port": 3000,
            "outFiles": []
        }
    ```

4. Try to attach.


**Expected**
An error message should be displayed about trying to attach to a bad port

**Actual**
We temporarily go into debug mode and then exit out of it after about a second. No error messages are displayed in the UI

data.body:

data.title: JS debugger showing wrong file when there are files with the same name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: macOS El Capitan (10.11)
- JS environment: React, Mocha, Enzyme

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a module (e.g. src/myfile.js).
2. Create a test file with the same name in a different directory (e.g. test/myfile.js).
3. Set a breakpoint in src/myfile.js.
4. Run the test.
5. When the breakpoint hits in src/myfile.js, try and go back in the callstack to test/myfile.js. It will instead show src/myfile.js with the debugger stopped on some random line.

And as a sanity check, rename one of the files and see everything work correctly.

PS I love VSCode, thank you guys for the best editor ever <3

data.title: Error running tests: TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of null
data.body:
- VSCode Version: v1.11.1
- OS Version: macOS v10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Pull down MavensMate-VisualStudioCode extension from https://github.com/kidtsunami/MavensMate-VisualStudioCode/tree/command-tests
2. Run cmd `yarn`
3. Run cmd `npm test`
4. Observe:
```bash
mavensdavid:MavensMate-VisualStudioCode davidhelmer$ npm test

> mavensmate@0.6.2 test /Users/davidhelmer/Work/mavens-mate/MavensMate-VisualStudioCode
> node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/test

### VS Code Extension Test Run ###
Current working directory: /Users/davidhelmer/Work/mavens-mate/MavensMate-VisualStudioCode
Downloading VS Code into "/Users/davidhelmer/Work/mavens-mate/MavensMate-VisualStudioCode/.vscode-test" from: https://vscode-update.azurewebsites.net/1.11.1/darwin/stable
Error running tests: TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of null
npm ERR! Test failed.  See above for more details.```

data.title: Strange syntax highlighting
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

```
Version 1.11.1
Commit d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39
Date 2017-04-06T13:55:56.395Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```

- OS Version:

```
$ cat /etc/lsb-release 
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=16.04
DISTRIB_CODENAME=xenial
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS"
```

I stumbled across strange syntax coloring, I can't recall if this was present before.

![zrzut ekranu z 2017-04-07 16-09-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/141999/24803972/39054138-1bad-11e7-9007-70c876ff5ddf.png)

I used Monokai theme to make the problematic parts more visible - note `define` on lines 13 and 22, and `include` on lines 17 and 18. This is consistent across all colour schemes I have installed, including defaults.

data.title: "maccenteuro" encoding works but not accepted value!
data.body:
We have MSVSCode 1.11.1. We need file encoding "maccenteuro". I set it in settings manually - it works, however, it says that value is not accepted.

Moreover, when this encoding is enabled, search in multiple files is not working.

We can repeat it on Windows 10 and Mac OS 10.12.

data.title: Report search results in a treeview
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

It would be nice if the search results panel had the ability to show search results in a a tree view that matches the layout of the folder structure of your project.

I'm working in a JS React project and a lot of the search results will report back the file index.js.  A file with that name is all over the place by necessity.  The location of the file is listed next to the name, but it's not as intuitive as a treeview would be.

Thanks,
Matt B.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Update to v1.11.x
2. Verify `"window.newWindowDimensions": "inherit"` is set in settings.json
3. Close editor
4. Open new editor
5. Observe default position and size for new window

data.title: Zoom level on separate windows
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

I am using VS Code on two different displays. I want ti zoomed in on one of them and zoomed out on the other, but VS code syncs the zoom settings between open windows.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two windows
2. Zoom in one window
3. The other window zooms in too

data.title: Warning french translation
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599375/24802486/809f8e90-1ba8-11e7-96f7-3156d9e44a41.png)

"Avertir" translation is "to warn"
Correct translation is "Avertissement" or best : "**Attention**"
